description: As a young professional, I want to connect with professionals established in certain fields, so that I can chat with them about their daily work.
acceptance_criteria: This story will be finished when: An individual can connect with other professionals to chat.
feedback:
Overall quality: needs work

Independent: This user story is not clearly self-contained. It does not mention any specific functionality or feature that needs to be developed. It is also not clear whether the chat should happen through a website, an app, or any other platform. To improve independence, the user story should mention the specific functionality or feature that needs to be developed, such as a "Connect with Professionals" button or a "Chat with Professionals" feature.

Negotiable: This user story captures the essence of the user's need but leaves room for improvement. It could provide more details on the types of professionals the user wants to connect with or how the connection will be facilitated. This will allow for a better understanding and conversation with the development team.

Valuable: Connecting with professionals and chatting with them about their daily work can be valuable to a young professional. However, the user story does not clearly mention any value proposition or specific benefits the user expects from this feature. To improve value, it should mention the potential benefits such as learning from experienced professionals, gaining industry insights, or expanding professional network.

Estimable: The user story is too vague to be estimated accurately. It does not provide any specific details or requirements, making it difficult for the development team to estimate the effort required to implement the feature. To make it estimable, it should provide more specifics about the expected functionality, user interface, and any integration requirements.

Small: The user story is too broad and lacks specific details about the desired functionality. It is not clear what it means to "connect with professionals" and how the chat feature should be implemented. To make it small and manageable, the user story should focus on a specific aspect or feature related to connecting with professionals and chatting with them.

Testable: The user story does not provide any acceptance criteria that can be used to confirm its implementation. To make it testable, it should include specific criteria such as "User should be able to search for professionals by industry", "User should be able to initiate a chat with a professional", and "User should receive real-time notifications for new chat messages".

Alternative User Story:
As a young professional, I want to be able to search for professionals in specific industries and start a chat with them, so that I can learn from their experiences and gain industry insights.

Acceptance Criteria:
- User should be able to search for professionals based on industry
- User should be able to initiate a chat with a selected professional
- User should receive real-time notifications for new chat messages

The development team can estimate the effort needed to implement the ability to speak with a veterinarian or staff member when calling the emergency line, enable easy access to contact information on the website or mobile app, and set up a 24/7 phone line for emergencies.

Acceptance Criteria: Good

The acceptance criteria should be specified as a separate section. It should define specific criteria that can determine whether the user story has been successfully implemented. For example:

  • There should be clear and visible navigation options (like buttons or links) to enter the forums.
  • Without requiring guidance the Interface clearly displays what actions a student can perform.
Out of scope for this story:
  • Assumes the student is already registered
  • Responsive Interface across different devices is not a focus for this story.
feedback:
Overall quality: Good

Independent: The user story is independent as it focuses on the user's need to have an easy and straightforward process to enter and participate in discussion forums without depending on other stories.

Negotiable: The user story captures the essence of the user's need and leaves room for conversation. It is not overly prescriptive like a contract.

Valuable: The user story delivers value to the end user by providing an easy and straightforward process to access and engage in discussion forums.

Estimable: The user story can be estimated based on the provided acceptance criteria, allowing it to be properly prioritized and fit into sprints.

Small: The user story is small enough to be completed in about 3 to 4 days.

Testable: The user story can be confirmed through the acceptance criteria provided.

Acceptance Criteria: Good

The acceptance criteria provide clear and specific objectives for when the story will be considered finished. It includes criteria for effortless access to the discussion forums, clear navigation options, and a user interface that clearly displays available actions. However, it would be beneficial to make the acceptance criteria more measurable and include specific user actions or expected outcomes.

Alternative user story:

As a student, I want to be able to search and filter discussions in the forum by accommodation-related topics, so I can easily find relevant discussions and engage with peers on those topics.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The search functionality allows me to search for discussions based on keywords related to accommodation.
- The filtering options allow me to narrow down discussions to only those related to accommodation.
- When I enter a relevant keyword or apply a filter, the forum displays only the discussions that match my search/filter.
- I am able to participate in discussions and engage with peers on the selected accommodation-related topics.

This alternative user story focuses specifically on the search and filtering functionality within the discussion forums, providing additional value to the end user.
